svcproc.para: The air horn provides the driver audio warning to warn others.

The air horn switch is a direct input (not multiplexed) to the ESC. When the horn button is pushed the ESC provides voltage to the air solenoid (4-pack or 7-pack air solenoids) to operate the air horn. The circuits from the steering wheel travel through a clock spring assembly, which is used instead of a slip ring assembly. It winds and unwinds as the wheel is turned. The instrument panel air horn switch is provided for the passenger to operate the air horn.
When the horn is connected to the 4-pack, the ESC provides voltage and direct SSC circuits for the 4-pack air horn air solenoids.
When the horn is connected to the 7-pack, the ESC will communicate on the body builder 1939 data link to command the applicable air solenoid on.
